snippet: The private equity firm said on Monday that it had named Robert Mancini -- the chief executive of the power company Cogentrix and a managing director at Goldman Sachs -- as the co-head of its $1.14 billion infrastructure fund.
abstract: The private equity firm said on Monday that it had named Robert Mancini -- the chief executive of the power company Cogentrix and a managing director at Goldman Sachs -- as the co-head of its $1.14 billion infrastructure fund.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Carlyle Hires Goldman Executive as Co-Head of Its Infrastructure Fund
